page.title: 13RECREATION IN GRANGETOWN
page.content: { Baseball { Baseball very simply consists of two sides of eleven players.The object of the game is to make progress around four bases,scoring one to four runs in the process.The rules are more complex but the side which scores the most runs wins. Despite attempts to spread the game, Baseball is only played in Cardiff, Newport and Liverpool. Grangetown is said to be the home of Baseball,having produced great sides of the past.Today the game still thrives,with children and adults taking part.At{Sevenoaks Park {(172/752)}on a Summer's evening,it is common to have four games taking place,with many families sitting around the "diamonds" (pitches) enjoying the sport.
